titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the D.C. Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 108-468.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 168.

action.text: Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 389.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

reference.ref: text as passed House CR H2743

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 5/12/2004--Passed Senate without amendment. Authorizes the 2004 District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run to be run through the Capitol grounds on June 4, 2004.
